title: Apple objects to links to outside payments ahead of Epic Games hearing
text: Apple Inc on Friday outlined its objections to allowing app developers to link to third-party payment options ahead of a hearing next month that could determine whether a set of antitrust court orders is put on pause.

title: Why Apple Stock Fell Today
text: Supply chain challenges are weighing on the iPhone maker's sales and profits.

title: U.S. Stock ETFs Try to Look Past Amazon, Apple Q3 Problems
text: U.S. markets and stock exchange traded funds were clawing back late on Friday after reeling in early morning trading on a pessimistic holiday outlook from e-commerce giant Amazon and iPhone maker Apple. The Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (RSP), which follows the S&P 500 Equal Weight Index (EWI), dipped 0.1% on Friday.

title: GuruFocus Members Are Researching These Stocks for the Holidays
text: As investors prepare for Halloween, the top six stocks that GuruFocus members are researching for the holidays are Intel Corp. ( INTC , Financial), Apple Inc. ( AAPL , Financial), Biogen Inc. ( BIIB , Financial), Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. ( BABA , Financial), Walmart Inc. ( WMT , Financial) and Micron Corp. ( MU , Financial) according to GuruFocus Virtual Baskets statistics.

title: US stocks close higher despite Apple and Amazon earnings misses
text: 4:05pm: US equities end higher  US stocks closed higher despite earnings misses by Apple and Amazon. Amazon shares dropped after the e-commerce giant badly missed earnings and revenue expectations for the third quarter while issuing disappointing guidance for the critical holiday period.

title: Even Big Tech Has Supply Chain Problems
text: A recurring theme this earnings season has been supply-chain woes and shortages of essential inputs, as well as labor, with not even the mighty Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) immune from the issues.

title: Big Tech Can't Always Win—Lessons From a Disappointing Week
text: Microsoft is still hot. The supply-chain problems are getting worse, and the big e-commerce boom is officially over.

title: Why Apple Analysts Prefer To Look Past Supply Chain Challenges, Remain Bullish After Q4 Revenue Miss
text: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares have come under selling pressure after the company's fourth-quarter revenues missed expectations amid supply chain constraints. The Apple Analysts: Morgan Stanley analyst Katy Huberty maintained an Overweight rating on Apple shares and reduced the price target from $166 to $164.

title: Apple says it competes with PlayStation, Xbox, and Nintendo in sign of gaming importance
text: Previously, Apple only said it competed against Google's Android in smartphones and Microsoft Windows in PCs for the attention of software developers.

title: Which FAANG Stock Performs Best Through Year-End 2021?
text: I'm often asked about the FAANG stocks, or what I call the FANMAG names: Facebook (FB), Amazon (AMZN), Netflix (NFLX), Microsoft (MSFT), Apple (AAPL) and Google (GOOG). Usually the question is phrased as, “Should we own the FAANG stocks here?

title: Microsoft unseats Apple as most valuable company
text: Microsoft leapfrogged Apple for one of Wall Street's most prestigious financial milestones.

title: Apple upset: Microsoft is now the world's most valuable company
text: Apple lost its crown as the world's most valuable public company to Microsoft on Friday, as the iPhone maker's shares continued their downward slide. Apple took a $6 billion hit to its sales during the fiscal fourth quarter due to a nagging global supply chain problem, leading to a miss on Wall Street expectations.

title: Apple (AAPL) Q4 Earnings In Line, Chip Shortage Hurts Top-Line
text: Apple's (AAPL) fourth-quarter fiscal 2021 results reflect robust performance of iPhone and Services segments amid supply chain constraints.

title: Is it safe to buy Apple shares as supply chain constraints weigh on sales?
text: On Friday, Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares plunged nearly 4% after announcing its most recent quarterly results. The company reported its fiscal third-quarter revenue and earnings Thursday after markets opened, matching earnings expectations.

title: US stocks mixed midday as Apple and Amazon results disappoint
text: 12.05 pm: Nasdaq pulls back from record high as supply chain issues weigh US stocks were mixed in noon trading as tech giants Apple and Amazon warned of a difficult fourth quarter due to labour and supply chain issues. At midday, the Dow rose 35 points to 35,768, while the S&P 500 was off 4 points at 4,594 and the tech-heavy Nasdaq eased 31 points to 15,417.

title: Friday Afternoon Analyst Upgrades and Downgrades: Altria, Apple, Caterpillar, IBM and More
text: Markets slid on Friday after earnings from Apple and Amazon failed to impress investors.

title: Apple spent nearly $20 billion on stock buybacks in Q4 at average prices below the VWAP
text: Apple Inc. AAPL, -3.47% did a decent job with the nearly $20 billion it spent on open-market stock repurchases during the fiscal fourth quarter, as the average price paid was slightly below the average prices for each month and the quarter. In the technology behemoth's 10-K annual report filed early Friday with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Apple said it repurchased 35.04 million shares from Aug. 29 to Sept.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway will collect nearly $800 million in Apple dividends this year - and that figure is likely to rise in the future
text: The famed investor's company, which owns 5.5% of Apple, has raked in an average of $775 million in dividends from the iPhone maker in past years.

title: FAANG Stock Plunges After Missing Revenue Estimates
text: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stepped into the earnings confessional yesterday to report fiscal fourth-quarter earnings that were in line with Wall Street's estimates, while revenue missed estimates.

title: Apple chip shortage will end, but U.S.-China supply chain 'train wreck' is coming
text: Apple say it lost $6 billion in sales due to the chip shortage. A longer-term U.S.-China battle over tech supremacy will create more supply chain chaos.

title: Why Apple Shares Are Falling
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL) shares are trading lower after the company reported inline fourth-quarter earnings per share results and worse-than-expected fourth-quarter sales results. Apple's fourth-quarter revenues of $83.4 billion missed the consensus estimate, with iPhone revenues of $38.9 billion trailing the consensus estimate of $41.3 billion.

title: Apple falls after iPhone supply-chain disruption drives first revenue miss since 2018
text: "It's not a demand issue, but a supply issue that continues to be the elephant in the room for Apple heading into holiday season," Wedbush said.

title: Microsoft set to overtake Apple as largest U.S. company for first time since July 2020
text: Microsoft Corp. is set to overtake Apple Inc. as the most valuable U.S. company for the first time in 15 months after the smartphone giant reported a rare sales miss in the face of supply constraints.

title: Supply chain issues slashed $6 billion off of Apple's revenue, which doesn't bode well
text: What will dominate this holiday shopping season: Huge demand, as shoppers use pent-up savings to splurge, or supply chain problems leading to empty shelves and presents on back order?

title: Munster Says '​​Perceived Miss' Drove Down Apple Shares, Expects Growth In Mid-Teens In December Quarter
text: Former Piper Jaffray Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) analyst Gene Munster said that despite supply headwinds, the iPhone maker could look forward to mid-teens growth in the December quarter. What Happened: “Under the headline that the supply headwind will worsen in December, pushing demand into March, is the reality that Apple's business and outlook are stronger than ever," the Loup Ventures co-founder wrote in a blog.

title: Apple set to hand crown of world's most valuable company to Microsoft
text: Apple Inc is set to lose its crown as the world's most valuable public company to Microsoft Corp if the iPhone maker's shares continue their downward slide when the market opens on Friday.

title: These 2 Tech Giants Are Hammering the Nasdaq Friday
text: When these two companies speak, investors listen.

title: Stock futures slide as Apple, Amazon struggle with supply chain bottlenecks
text: U.S. stock futures were lower Friday morning as the supply chain crunch weighed on results from Apple and Amazon.

title: Futures slip after Apple, Amazon results reignite supply, labor woes
text: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq indexes looked set to drop from record highs on Friday, as results from mega-cap firms Apple and Amazon.com reignited concerns of labor and supply shortages that have been at the forefront of this quarterly earnings season.

title: How Apple is gaining smartphone customers during a chip shortage
text: Apple Inc is eating into its rivals' smartphone market share as the iPhone maker navigates through a global chip crunch better than other mobile phone makers, according to data providers.

title: Apple's stock drop after earnings can be blamed for more than half of Dow futures' decline
text: Shares of Apple Inc. AAPL, +2.50% sank 3.7% early Friday, to pace the Dow Jones Industrial Average's DJIA, +0.68% premarket decliners by a wide margin, in the wake of the technology behemoth's disappointing fiscal fourth-quarter results. The stock's implied price decline would shave about 37 points off the Dow's price, while Dow futures YM00, -0.19% fell 69 points, or 0.2%, with 17 of 30 components trading lower.

title: US stocks set to end the week on the back foot after disappointing updates from both Apple and Amazon
text: US stocks look set to end the week on the back foot after quarterly reports released after-hours on Thursday from both Apple Inc and Amazon Inc showed the impact of supply-chain problems and tight labor markets. Futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average were 0.2% lower in Friday, while those for the S&P 500 fell 0.5%, and contracts for the tech-laden Nasdaq-100 shed 0.9% weighed by disappointments from two of its biggest components.

title: US stocks set to end the week on the back foot after quarterly earnings disappoinment from both Apple and Amazon
text: US stocks look set to end the week on the back foot after quarterly reports released after-hours on Thursday from both Apple Inc and Amazon Inc showed the impact of supply-chain problems and tight labor markets. Futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average were 0.2% lower in Friday, while those for the S&P 500 fell 0.5%, and contracts for the tech-laden Nasdaq-100 shed 0.9% weighed by disappointments from two of its biggest components.

title: Is There Room for Another Company in the Adtech Industry?
text: The adtech market is heating up as more entrants join the space, but one company in particular is catching eyes.

title: The Ratings Game: It's transitory. Analysts shake off Apple's earnings disappointment and stay focused on 2022 demand
text: Investors were pushing the sell button on Apple Inc. shares early Friday, following disappointing results, but many Wall Street analysts held their bullish ground, saying demand for the tech giant's products is not going anywhere.

title: Apple continues descent after mixed update
text: Apple Inc is continuing its descent on Friday after posting record numbers that were still below expectations. Investors were also spooked by chief executive Tim Cook's statement on supply chain troubles.

title: Market Snapshot: Stock futures point to sharp losses for tech after disappointing Amazon and Apple results
text: U.S. stock futures were lower on Friday, with technology poised for a sharp selloff, as investors reacted to disappointing results from heavyweights Amazon.com Inc. and Apple Inc.

title: Amazon, Apple weighed down by supply and chip troubles
text: Amazon and Apple announced billions of dollars in quarterly profits on Thursday, but supply chain bottlenecks and the global chip shortage dented the tech giants, which have been riding a pandemic-stoked boom.

title: Apple's strong quarter suffers $6B blow from supply shortage
text: Apple's iPhone sales soared yet again in the past quarter, but didn't grow as rapidly as analysts anticipated because of supply shortages that have made it more difficult to meet the demand for a wide range of products.
